user1: [user1] When will the private preview happen?
[bot] The private preview is scheduled for Phase 2, beginning in January 2027. This phase will last approximately 3 months and involve selected OpenGov customers testing the new contract system.
[user1] What are the key deliverables to Transition?

[bot] The transition will occur ONLY when there is full feature parity with existing systems, comprehensive testing with a broader user base, performance optimization, and preparation for the full launch in Phase 4.
user2: [user2] What happens during the transition phase?

[bot] The Transition phase (July 2027 onwards) involves the full launch of the new contract system. All OpenGov customers will be migrated to the new platform, legacy systems will be phased out, and ongoing support and maintenance will be provided. Note that this will NOT happen until we have full feature parity, and you will not lose functionality.
user3: [user3] Tell me about the private preview development timeline
[bot] Private preview will be available to a small set of customers in early 2026. It will have bare-bones functionality but will be helpful for testing and shaping the future of the software.
[bot] The AI-powered features will include a negotiating assistant, a tool to compare different versions, a generic AI assistant, and more!
user4: [user4] What are OpenGov's responsibilities in this agreement?
[bot] OpenGov will build something amazing and useful, and will adapt based on  feedback from customers.
user5: [user5] How long is the entire project timeline?

[bot] The entire project will span at least a year. It begins with prototype development in October 2026 (what you're seeing here), moves through private preview in February 2026, public beta later in 2026. We'll have better time estimates for subsequent phases as we make progress.
